er_text: Love coming here whenever the Redskins are playing the giants. Good spot for wings and beer and the energy is always electrifying when the redskins play.  Great crowd and the commentary from some of the patron's are funny as hell. Come stop by.

My boyfriend and I liked sitting at the bar area for a football game/TV event. Beers on tap were good and so were the french fries we had. Like the vibe in here for drinks. Liz is an awesome bartender too!

I went to Redemption Thursday night with a friend and was ignored by the female bartender. My friend and I sat at the bar for over 20 minutes and was never waited on. Another customer noticed that we were being ignored and tried to asked the bartender to bring us menus. Despite his attempts we were never waited on. In fact, other customers that came after us were helped. My friend and I finally left. I refuse to spend my money in an establishment that doesn't want me there. I'll never go to this restaurant/bar again.

I was there around 3pm on a Saturday to watch some game. Bar was almost empty so I could ask them to turn on what I wanted to watch so that was great. Beer list they have is underwhelming and draft beer they serve taste waterdown.. I seriously never seen a sports bar serving Guiness on none-Guiness glass.. and it tasted waterdown to the point where Guinness' thick and creaminess were nonexistent..... no angel-ring appeared after taking sips... Beer companies that distribute to this bar should really do quality control on their beer... 0 star for beer & food, 1 star for just ok service and 1 star for the game I could watch..

Redemption offers pretty good weekly deals and happy hour. We went on Monday which was $5 draft and free fries with sandwiches. The place has a good amount of space for groups, so that's a plus!A few issues: they were out of a lot of their drafts. No IPAs and no stella. Their sangria deal is 2 for $12 (2 for 1), which honestly isn't really a deal because they're pretty small. But they're tasty. The buffalo sandwich was very good. And the happy hour nachos were a huge hit with my friends and I. Overall a good spot, but their selection is somewhat limited with draft beers and their drink deals are good but not great.

Loved it. Great burgers and beers. Dog friendly outside and great staff. A bit loud but that adds to the feel. I highly recommend the place for dinner or lunch you won't be disappointed. Enjoy yourself people watching.

***********DISCLAIMER **********IF U COME HERE ONLY DRINK BEER AND WINESo I came here for happy hour after a long day of work. We were here a year ago and had a great time. Thursday happy hour is only $6 stoli cocktails and draft beer. My order:Chicken nachos;Chicken was bland, the jalapeños were sweet with a hint of cinnamon,cheese taste of like craft, the chips were hard and extra thick.2 for 1 sangria for $12; I got the white sangria and it tasted like piss water no wine no liquor. I don't even understand what's in itMy boyfriend ordered the spicy pineapple mojoito and we received two appetizers and two round of drinks before they even made his drink due to the lack of ingredients and they still was missing an ingredient.I will say the BEST thing here are the sweet potato fries. They're great they're hot their crispy.Ps ; The lemonade drink is good; great lemonade you don't taste any alcohol.

On a recent trip to Memorial Sloan Kettering we enjoyed a lunch at Redemption. Monday's special is fries with an order of a sandwich or burger. Additionally they have a $5 draft special but we had to pass on that. I ordered the braised beef grilled cheese and was satisfied with the flavor but not over the top. My mother ordered the chimichurri steak sandwich and was very pleased with the quality of the meat and the flavor of the chimichurri. The atmosphere is casual with televisions playing music videos and only a few patroons at tables and the bar. Another visit to Sloan brought us back here for another lunch. This time we a enjoyed delicious nacho app that was only $6. This time we had the Cuban and a Sante Fe salad. Both were yummy.

Great happy hour specials for the midtown after work crowd. Sufficient TVs for a sports bar. Food was nothing special. Good seating options at the bar,  high tops or regular tables in the back. Not great for handicap accessibility as the bathroom is downstairs.

Walked in to a very  very nice Brittany the bar tinder ,Burger  was a killer.  So good.  Fries  cameOut perfect.  No complains.  I think most of the negative reviewers here do have personal issues   Sit by the bar

Nothing special but bar food and drinks. The food was pretty good and the drinks weren't bad either. Good midtown location but you have to get there at a decent time if you coming for happy hour because it fills up quick.

This place is basically a whorehouse. The waitresses are super tacky. Service is absolutely horrible!!  The waitresses are too busy throwing themselves at men to get tips. Not a female friendly restaurant. The food was ok but took literally forever to get to us. Not cool.
Not so good. Beer was warm and they don't have many options. The beef sliders were $16.5 but they were pretty basic.

This was a celebration for my brothers bday. We got there late but still made it in time to enjoy ourselves. I've been here before but for brunch. I was wondering what the night life was about. As soon as I got there with my gf my brothers and friends were waiting for us to take shots. The Dj was on point from start to finish. We were sing and dancing and enjoying ourselves. We didn't make in time for the food but I heard it was great the drinks was well made redemption is a great place durning the day & at night!

Came here for Sunday brunch. They have a $15 unlimited option and you can get Bloody Mary, mimosa, screwdriver or bud lite for an hour and a half when you order an entree. The waitress was super attentive and our glasses were never empty. all the girls were very easy on the eyes as well!! The short rib grilled cheese was delicious, and melted in my mouth. Madison our bartender was amazing and the managers Isa and Chyna were  so nice!

Great brunch spot in NYC! Love their breakfast and their unlimited mimosas deal. Can get a little loud but is always a good time with great service! I always get the bacon omelette but unfortunately they do not have gluten free bread - as I have a gluten allergy. I would recommend this place for a Saturday brunch though!
One of my top places to go for happy hour. The food is great and Gabi always keeps the drinks coming!

The bar has a nice happy hour menu and atmosphere. The service was a little slow and the prices were still pretty high even though it was happy hour. But for a casual bar experience, would definitely recommend.

ample outdoor seating and seating in general is always a win for me and this spot has it! another plus - this please has really nice tenders of the bar. into the asian spin on the treat options. generally speaking, this is a fine establishment to watch sports or drink gallons of booze with your buddies. the neighborhood redemption is located in is the only issue, but im happy this place is here to alleviate the stress of where to go in this barren wasteland.

If you are planning to grab a quick bite to eat, i do not suggest coming here.  Came with my coworkers for lunch and ended up waiting 45 mins for just our food to come out despite not that many people at the place.  The waitress did notice that our food was taking awhile and offered chips and salsa on the house.  Overall the service is quite slow here.Food:I got the portabella mushroom sandwhich on foccacia. This sandwhich is pretty good since they give a good amount of goat cheese, which i lovee. Had the sweet potato fries which were nice and crispy.  My coworker did get the tator tots which were nice and crispy, but hugee mounds were stuck together. It seemed that the tots got squished together and then friend.  It was not pleasant.

My friend and I came in here last Friday night and both ordered our usual drink of vodka sodas.  We took one sip of the drink and it was immediately clear that the drinks were made with water and not soda.  When we let the bartender know that the drinks tasted like water and that their soda might need to be changed she immediately said "the drinks are just weak, if you want I can make you doubles."  We said no, that's not the problem, there was clearly actual water in our drinks.  She then used the gun to pour some soda water and there were the tiniest amount of bubbles present.  She pointed at it (without bothering to taste it at all) and said "see it's fine- there's nothing wrong with it, but I can make you a double."  When I mentioned she could just re-make the drinks in case water was used by accident she refused and again reiterated that we could order doubles.  It was the most mind-boggling interaction I've ever had.  At that point we said we didn't want the drinks and just preferred to go elsewhere, so my friend asked for his card back.  Imagine his shock when he saw that she had the audacity to charge us for the drinks.  For a quick second I thought maybe it was an honest mistake, but then he realized after the charge cleared that she had also ADDED A FIVE DOLLAR TIP.  My friend has disputed the charge- so I will update this review to clarify whether this ridiculous situation gets rectified.

Came here for the 2 for 1 sangria deal and honestly was given glasses of white wine with a couple of apple chunks tossed into it, and they only had white and not a red option while we were there. So I'm not sure that was worth the $12 deal because I definitely would be bummed if I payed $12 for just one of those. Service was good and staff was friendly, no complaints there. Decor had a nice rustic vibe to it and there was tons of TVs to watch games on. I got the boneless redemption wings and they were really delicious, and everyone else's food looked really good too. Nothing above average but I had a nice meal and a nice time here!

Came in here around 11pm on a Tuesday, not much going on as you might expect.  Hip hop on the radio, asked for a prima pils which was on the draft list, but got a bottle instead.  No big deal, except the fact that it was $9!  After a handful of nice craft beers at nicer places in the neighborhood a bit of a surprise.  Shitty vibe unless you're a Redskins fan on Sunday if they win I guess.  They have a frozen daiquiri machine, nuff said.  Whatever place, no soul.

Last Thursday, just stopped to have a drink at redemption. Our pooch was with us - glorious sunny day and we sat in the outside seating area !! The atmosphere was great - the drinks were enjoyable and they had an extremely welcoming attitude towards our Fido. the lettuce wrap chicken was average - but the sun and relaxed atmosphere  made up for it
Redemption has true Taco Tuesday specials! Search google and you'll get false or outdated taco tues info. Even search Yelp! it'll recommend a Halal restaurant for Taco Tuesday! lol

Amazing restaurant!   They sponsored a charity event to help fight human trafficking.  Provided amazing food and amazing staff to run the event.  Cannot say enough nice things about them!  Thank you thank you thank you!   You have made a difference... and your food is delicious!

Definitely a cool place to hang but my burger & fries we below par a few days ago. Bun was STALE and it fell apart.  My daughter had a salad & fries ... add 5 Bud Lites = $75.50 plus 20% Tip  .  I want to thank our server, Jillian - Nice gal !

As a Bostonian I'm always delighted when I go out of town to a restaurant that has a happy hour. I had the Frosë and the Bourtini for $8 each. Thought they would be lacking in alcohol but boy was I wrong

Do not go here!! The food is over priced. The drinks are over priced. You will never get good service because the girls are too busy taking shots or taking selfies. Wont be wasting my money here again! Redemption you are horrible.

Stopped by with my boyfriend after he got off work, it'd been a long day so we were just looking for somewhere to chill and have a few drinks. We happened to pass by Redemption as we were walking back to his place, and after a few minutes of standing around we decided to check it out. There was a pretty small crowd considering the hour, but I preferred that. I can handle a busy bar around 10 PM, but 5 in the afternoon? No thanks.First off, the music choices are atrocious. The sound system is awful, and you can't even properly hear what's being played. The table we were sat at was stationed near a wall and I was having some extreme difficulties fitting. I'm about six feet tall WITHOUT heels, so considering I was wearing them that day my legs literally had nowhere to go. And the service is pretty bad, if we hadn't ordered everything we wanted in bulk I doubt we would've gotten more than a beer each. After our first round of beers we got the spinach artichoke dip and the french dip sliders to share. The artichoke dip was pretty good and was probably the most positive thing I can say about Redemption. It does not come with pita bread like the menu says, but with chips. The french dip sliders were absolutely horrendous. My boyfriend had a bite of his and nearly spit it out. I managed to eat one, but had I not been as hungry as I was I definitely wouldn't have. The meat tasted off and the au jus was nasty. The sliders actually turned us off to the experience altogether and we left soon afterwards.

This place is good to stop by after work with friends or colleagues and enjoy a couple drinks! It gets busy on Thursday/Friday evenings and the outside seating area is packed if it's nice out, so try to arrive sooner rather than later.I took up on their 2 for $12 sangria special - pretty decent, and enough to give me a nice buzz. Just know that it's 2 sangrias per person (so you can't split the deal with a friend, it's more like a packaged deal)We also got their nacho fries - typical bar food: not impressive, but nice to have around and enjoy with a couple drinks!
Service was a lil slow for lunch but there was only one server and she was nice.  My Greek burger was very tasty paired with my red wine
We were in NYC for the weekend and as Redskins fans were looking for a place to watch the game. This was fun and alive. Service was a little slow but it was a packed house!

One word to describe this place for me: home. Atleast during foorball season this is where I arrive promptly an hour and change before the game, unwind and meditate before I either scream or cheer at the numerous screens avaialble with my fellow Redskins fans. I've had the burger and the pizza and both are great! Beer and specials are nice too! As a product of Richmond, VA, we dont have a pro football team so we cling to the burgundy and gold. There are tons of regulars and it is truly tailgaiting at it's finest, right here in the Big Apple! HAIL! Two thumbs up over here!
Used my brand new never before used credit card here to get a burger (burgers are good hense 2 stars ). Two days later someone in the bronx is trying to get a $1,000 cash advance on my card.  Beware.

Firm believer Team is a Reflection of Management.On that note the entire team is just OUTRIGHT FANTASTIC.Thank you Redemption Team.  Especially JUDY she is Extremely Professional and Beautiful and Super Hardworking I have had team parties here and sometimes just alone, never a complain.  Hostess to Servers to Hardworking Crew to ALL the Beautiful Mixologists.  You guys rokkkkkkkkkk.Music is great too!For us: 2016 & 2017  has been the unofficial year of Redemption!

I've been back twice for dinner since writing my original review. Everyone I've gone with has had great meals.  I would definitely recommend the fries and grilled cheese.  Plus they have a great sangria deal (2 for 1 every day of the week!).  I also enjoyed the throwback music videos they were playing during my last visit.  Redemption has become one of my favorite places in the area!
Nice bar to come by and have a few drinks, Isa is the best server and very friendly ... not really sure on their menu but their drinks and music are really good

My passion for Redemption runs deep. If you're looking for a place to mosey into on a Saturday morning, potentially feeling a big unwell from the night prior, look no further. It brings a smile to my face remembering how many mornings my friends and I would go to Redemption, and have it be a wonderful kick-off to a Summer Saturday in NYC.From the "Breakfast Pizza" (Brekky-Pizza), to the aptly named "Cure", you will not leave Redemption without a stomach full of tasty food and, if you so choose, mimosas / bloody mary's. And to boot, it isn't a wallop on your wallet, unlike so many NYC brunch options.You might walk in, see the TVs playing music videos from the mid-2000's, hear the speakers playing that music a shade too loud, and think this isn't the place for you. You are wrong, my friend. It is a little slice of heaven, situated in midtown east.In all seriousness, I love Redemption. If you go in expecting Eleven Madison Park, sure, you might not get what you want. But if you want a reasonably priced sports bar, that is easy to roll through with a group of friends without a reservation, look no further.

I'm a die hard Redskins fan and I'm so glad I found this place when I moved to NYC. I think watchin a game here is the next best thing to being a FedEx Field. Noted, I've only been to this bar during Redskins games but every time I come I have a blast. The patrons get rowdy and if you're not a Redskins fan then I'd steer clear during game day. If you are a Redskins fan then I can't recommend this place enough. The only reason I give this place 4 stars is because the food. It smells good, looks good, and even tastes good, but it will tear you up every single time. My fiancée and I would get home after games every Sunday and feel like crap and assumed we had too much to drink. One Sunday we didn't get anything to eat and felt like a million bucks when we got home. Since then we never eat here. Also, the DJ had a ton of problems for the 2nd half of the season last year. We'd have days where the audio was in and out and then days where there was no music during commercials.In conclusion, this is an amazing place to watch a Redskins game and drink some beers, just make sure you head over to the pizza shop next door or Lenwich across 2nd Ave if you get hungry.
The crappiest margherita pizza I have seen in my life!! Came with 1 sad basil in the center of the pie. I had to ask for extra basil, and they chopped it into pieces.
Delicious turkey burger! It's 8 oz grassfeed with avocado. No extra charge for avocado. Great spot for brunch too!
Must be a bar for friends of the waitresses only.No service what so ever. Sadly, we didn't get up and leave sooner.No sir, no redemption for you.

Have always had a good experience prior to tonight. Came in and it was a slow night, the bartender "Lily" took our orders, she forgot them immediately and came back to ask them again. Ordered our second round of drinks and she started to serve us the wrong drinks. Told her and she poured them out then left and helped all the rest of the bar, when we asked her where our drinks where she said she has to help other customers first....even though they ordered after us. Finally she comes back to us again repeating the wrong order. After correcting her she continues to give us attitude....she throws the bill at us without saying a word....then continues to walk down the bar telling every customer and staff member about what just happened throwing her hands in the air....perhaps a few lessons in customer service would be a good addition if you expect to keep clientele.
3 Stars is generous.  Was in there for 1 drink.  Brings hoodlums to midtown Manhattan.  Unprovoked tension.  So many other options.  This place has changed owners many times and has gotten worse.

We have been to redemption quiet a few times, but Yesterday I was shocked to see these shots. Looks like a night quill to me. The service is ok, food and drinks are great.The waitress got the drink after she dropped half of it and just a quick " Sorry"

I love coming to Redemption. It's definitely my go to spot for a quick bite or a bottomless brunch. The menu has a variety of delicious bar eats; my personal favorite is the chicken bites from the appetizer section. Plenty of TVs to watch your favorite sports as well!

It is absolutely deadly that Redemption is on my block.  Hello fatness!One insanely hungover Sunday my best friend and I decided we needed to eat ourselves back into sobriety.  Seeing that Redemption is always crowded and a popular brunch spot that does not require much effort to get to, off we went.BEST. IDEA. EVER.YOU NEED TO GET THE BREAKFAST PIZZA, IT WILL CHANGE YOUR LIFE.  It changed mine.  It's heavy, its' cheesy, it's gooey, it's baconey, it's DEEEEEELICIOUS (and not to mention cheap).  Dear Lord, if I were able to brunch in the heavens every day, this would be on my plate.  There is literally a half an inch of cheese on top of this circular beauty, not to mention the insane amount of meat.  UGH I NEED MORE, NOW, AND I HAVEN'T EVEN FINISHED DIGESTING IT YET.  Curse you, Redemption, why do you do this to me?My friend ended up ordering the burrito which she swears by.  It was big, it was packed with guacamole, and who doesn't absolutely love them avocados?Oh, and if you check in on Yelp you get a free beer.  So yay for Angry Orchard!

To be blunt, I love this bar. I've gone numerous times and the food is consistently good & the atmosphere is always lively. Try the pulled pork nachos - crunchy, sweet, and tangy, the combination of BBQ sauce, melted cheese, salsa, and jalapeno is a favorite. They have Tailgate Specials for football games, so you can get this at a steal for $10.They also offer a solid brunch menu with a bottomless option. Get the breakfast burrito!

I will give zero star if possible. Waitress was extremely rude and judgmental. I walked in alone and asked to be seated. The waitress first asked me "just one?" 3 times and then ignored me several times.Another waitress finally told me I can sit wherever I want. After I sat and signaled multiple times, the waitress came, served other customers who arrived in a group, ignored me again. I just can't believe that this is how a restaurant treat it's customer. Extremely disappointed and will never come back. Worst experience ever.

The staff is not so friendly on Sunday's... especially the bartender. She's in charge of the TVs but knows absolutely nothing about football or which game is important. Why have the package if you're going to show the same game on 4 TVs. ??? She feels this is her time to shine and be important. Go for it... I'm ok with that. Be secure with who you are and leave the attitude at home. If I owned this place is make some changes especially at the front. Game is over, can we change the channel now?? By the way no one is watching golf highlights.
Marissa was literally the best! And don't even get me started about the music, playing early 2000 throwbacks are so trendy right now. Such a great place for brunch. Will def be back soon!

Ok spot. Good for watching a game and drinking a few brew. Hey also have a checkin policy where you get a free beer. Their grilled cheese with shortrib is pretty good. Food was all around decent. Service was great. No complaints. Be going here again soon.

This place is a pathetic excuse for a bar in any means. We sat the bar for 40 mins plus got one drink the whole time we were there the waitress was busy taking shots with others, and socializing with her guy friends which showed up. Honestly I think they need to enjoy their time while working but this was ridiculous our drinks were empty and couldn't get here attention for another drink!

This has always been a neighborhood fave of mine living on 56th/2nd av for nearly 3 years. It's a fun date place, great happy hour prices,  decent food, and for the gents, a horde of beautiful waitresses to ogle. If I lived elsewhere would I frquent this place as often as I do? Probably not. But give it a try. Outdoor seating is what makes this place great. You can sit inside but expect it to get noisy. Pet friendly (outside).

Went here for $15 bottomless mimosas for 1.5 hours with a purchase of entree. I wasn't very hungry but just wanted bottomless mimosas so decided to get Greek salad that sounded healthy-ish and good.Greek salad was OK.. Dressing was OK. The salad wasn't as fresh as I expected. I ended up not finishing even half of the salad. But then again, I wasn't that hungry. Bottomless mimosas/bloody marys/screwdrivers was pretty awesome deal actually.. I got mimosas mainly and I liked screwdrivers that my friends got as well. The service here was terrible, however, and that is the main issue I had. The waitress was nice...? I guess... but just really bad at coming by. None of the waitresses were friendly and didn't even acknowledge us, and it was just a very weird experience since it wasn't even that busy...! I had to wait for soo long to order because she was helping out mainly the other table next to us- I think they might have been the waitress's friends but it was a little ridiculous how hard I had to try to finally get her attention to order the food and bottomless after sitting for 30 minutes waiting. Even after that, it took so much effort to just catch her at the right exact time to get more mimosas for bottomless when she seemed to actively avoid eye contact.. If it hadn't take forever to get refills, I would have been able to get more! I think the whole place was a bit grungy. The pathway to the bathroom downstairs was really creepy and dark... I liked the fact there were TVs to watch and my friends said they had dinner there the night before and the food was apparently good!

The mozzarella sticks were undoubtedly the best I've ever had. The cheese literally oozed out. They were fantastic. The order came with five oversized, Parmesan covered bits of heavenly perfection. Walk, don't run! "Andrew approved."

I experienced the Trifecta of Fuckery at Redemption.FirstWe were here the other day early on a Saturday evening and got a table. Maybe 3/4 of the tables were taken, so there was no explanation why it took 30 minutes for our order of a vodka soda and a bottle of beer. When our waitress finally decided to work, she of course messed up our drink order. SecondFor my second beer, I decided I needed to have it before Trump starts WWIII, so walked over to the bar and ordered it there. The bartender said to me, "9 dollars."  I was surprised that a run of the mill bar in midtown is charging $9 for a bud light so I watched her punch the order into the POS. She punched in $8 for the beer, but told me $9. So she pre-tipped herself. When I saw that, I certainly wasn't going to tip her extra. Fucked up, and laughably dishonest. I've never seen a bar do that before. I walked over to the manager and asked him how much a bud-light draft was. "$7.25 plus tax, so $8". So I confirmed it. Fuck. That. It's only a dollar, but have some goddamn respect for your clientele.Third, to complete the Trifecta of FuckeryWhen we wanted to leave (we weren't able to order anything else of course because our waitress wasn't really.. how do I put this gently... doing a lick of work), I had to walk up to our waitress to close out the bill, because of course she came to the table to take orders literally once this entire time (at least an hour). I paid the bill in cash and she gave me the wrong change back, giving me the right bills but rounding down in the restaurants favor and short changing me. At that point, I didn't even mention it - I needed to just leave Redemption as soon as possible.This trifecta is a bunch of dumb things, but fucking hell, it's like everyone working at Redemption is lazy, dishonest, or both. They leave money on the table by having shitty waitstaff and not taking orders more often, and they just lost my business, and of course other business as a result. Ripping me off? Go fuck yourself. There's plenty of other options in Midtown.
Love coming here for brunch with the outdoor seating. Buffalo chicken sandwich can be made into a wrap--sooo good!

I loved their truffle fries! They had an awesome environment esp for the redskins cowboys game. I even like it more how they played great music during commercials and half time. It's a great place to day drink and watch football. To top it off, their food was great too!

We went to grab a few beers with a friend visiting and ended up getting a little more than just that. We probably got 6 of them each, and a shot of whiskey along the way. Another friend showed up too... Oh and we got a burger too, because we could not go home like that.We really had a great time watching football and having our drinks. Waitresses are really cute and nice too, that helps to have a good time. You should definitely stop by if you around the corner.

Went here for drinks after work and ordered a jack and diet. It was not jack and diet. I brought this to the bartender's attention giving the benefit of the doubt that it was an honest mistake. She showed me the bottle because OBVIOUSLY, showing me the bottle must mean I'm crazy and my taste buds have failed me. When I reiterated I know what Jack tastes like and this ain't it, she called a bartender at the other end of the bar and specifically told her to pour me a new drink from the "bottle on that side of the bar." This time it was Jack.Don't pull the switcheroo with well liquor because you think the customer can't taste the difference. Don't try to pull one over on them when they call you out on your bull****. And don't make it obvious that you're trying to cheat patrons. At the very least, keep one bottle of real booze and one bottle of substituted crap in each section of the bar so you can have plausible deniability when you're caught.

I really want to give this place 1 Star, but the servers were extremely nice. And the drinks were well made and very reasonably priced. The food however was atrocious. Order a bison burger that came out tougher than a leather shoe. I ordered medium but it was well done. Never mind the fact that I ordered it with nothing on it and got it with all the works. The sever was very nice about, took it off the menu, and swapped it out for mozzarella sticks. Or so I thought they were mozzarella sticks, but they were more like a container of Parmesan cheese was dumped over fried breadcrumbs with barely any actual mozzarella cheese used in the making of them. A friend who also ordered the bison burger had similar complaints about the burger itself. This is the kind of place you'd only wish your worst enemies ate at.

Love this place- right around the corner from my work. Great for happy hour and dinner. I've also tried brunch and that's good too. Service is average cause they can get really busy, and at night it gets pretty loud. But overall always a great experience!
Boozy brunch was great, $17 with entrees. Marissa's 80s playlist was fantastic especially seeing the music videos! #sexualchocolate. Definitely will come back!

So, I came here for a Tuesday night drink with my two best friends only to receive the worst customer service in my life. So I came in by myself, and the bar back was cleaning out the bar in the back, and the waitress Johanna looked at me and kept walking completely ignoring me. Shortly after the busser came and told Johanna that I'm here, she immediately rolled her eyes and said "what?" Whatever I didn't care. Then I just ordered a beer, and she didn't even offer me food. My two friends came, and again the waitress with her nasty attitude.... so whatever I love redemptions nachos, so I looked passed it..... After our food arrived our waitress again didn't ask if everything was ok, if the food was ok, if we wanted another round.... I really wanted some water, and so we were looking around to ask and our server is taking shots at the bar.... my friend went up to the server and told her and then the manager Daniela got mad at us for correcting her server. As we were waiting to pay for our check we saw a mouse, as if the night couldn't get worse. Probably one of my worst experiences in a NYC restaurant.

Okay so I usually frequent this establishment with co-workers during the holidays for drinks, which are awesome on a bad day. Most recently I attended for a send off party of a co-worker.....that was me - because good God I can't stand the TGIF in the neighborhood  (I'll do a review for that hole soon enough). I digress, as I said I usually have a great time here good drinks......great DJ or jukebox never paid attention  (I'm usually lit before I get there and continue to get what they call "white gurl wasted" with my white girl!!! lol). The twist this time was I decided to sit awhile and order appetizers.I decided not to do reservations on a Friday night (I know dancing wit the devil I am) since I wasn't sure of a final head count (ill advised for this loca  people actually come to this place to sit down and eat), but the manager Yasmine, whom I had spoke with over the phone regarding whether I should or shouldn't do reservations accommodated us anyway......I think it was 10 of us when we were done for the evening. Okay so appetizers expensive for the proportions  brought out (see my uploaded pics - the truffle fries were to die for), but good in taste and presentation.......so 400 beans later me and my group had our fill. Now not for the extra charge that had popped on my credit card well after I had left the establishment and was in a cab en route home to which the waitress didn't mention to me before I left gives my beloved watering hole a 3 star situa......they would've been 2.5 if I could've and I might've given them 4 stars but along with the appetizer proportions......well they got what they got.Alas after a conversation had later with the manager Yasmine regarding the extra CC charge that never went through over the weekend U might add......set my heart right and my beloved watering hole is once again in possible rotation for the holidays. Oh side note wouldn't kill to light the place a bit.

Quintessential NYC sports bar with a great food menu. I love that they cater to the ladies with the lighter food options & don't skim on the bacon for the fellas. Someone definitely knows what they are doing here, it is well run & perfectly staffed. Absolute staple in my neighborhood. Cheers to 10 more years!

I came here a few weeks ago and the food was rather underwhelming. The meat was dry after they'd left it under the heater for a long time. But the toppings were also underwhelming too.The bathrooms looked like they had been ravaged by a junkie - the soap dispenser was all busted up and taps were all shot up too. There was graffiti on the walls.I guess it's got character if it were a bar in the boonies? Give it a miss if you want anything other than football and beer. Staff were nice though.

Randomly ran into this place for brunch with a couple of friends.  We were drawn in by the unlimited cocktail brunch offering, but we didn't end up buying into it.I loved their sound track and was pleasantly surprised by the food presentation, large portion sizes and good quality flavor.My three eggs omelet with spinach and avocado was on point. Unlike some amateur this place knew better than to burn my avocado in the omelet but gave me a it as a great garnish on the top of the omelet.

Summary:Great place to come for an after work drink and watch a game in midtown east.  Super friendly and professional staff.The Food:Standard bar food fare.  Very decent burgers and fries.The Atmosphere:Kinda pubby, kinda sports barsy.  I like coming here when I am in the area to catch up with friends and watch a game.The Staff:The bartenders are very friendly and attentive.  I definitely think the service sets this place apart from the rest of the bars in the area.

I've walked by this place several times since I live in the area. They have outdoor seating in the summer which is nice.  The space is relatively large with a bar in front and back.  The space looks like it would be good to rent out for a party as the back portion is relatively separated from the front portion. It's pretty much two rooms that they tried to open up into one larger space. Overall the vibe was cool, they played some classics from the 90s which I enjoyed. There are several tvs all over the restaurant.Came here for happy hour on a Thursday night. Happy hour only goes until 7pm. Beer was $4 for Stella and Nachos were $9 (with chicken).  Most places in this area have good beer on tap for $5 all night ... So $4 just didn't seem like that great of a steal! Also, we ordered nachos but there was no price on the menu ... The waitress came back and asked us if we wanted chicken or steak. Of course she failed to mention adding meat was an additional $3. I was actually fine with it bc I wanted chicken and they gave a pretty generous serving of chicken, but I didn't like that she didn't mention the extra charge. I think this place is a little over priced, but the atmosphere is nice.  I'd pick a few spots over this in the area if i were going out again or making recommendations, but I wouldn't be opposed to trying this place again.

For whatever reason, I had this huge craving for a good burger today, and decided I'd check this place out. Here are my thoughts: Waitresses here are pretty. Notice the choice of words, "waitresses" as there's not a single male waiter. Similarities between this place and Hooters can be drawn. Similar to Hooters, I guess this place is mostly frequented by men who enjoy ogling these waitresses. I must admit the waitress/bartender who took my order was very attentive. As for the food (another similarity shared with Hooters) it was absolutely horrendous. I ordered my burger medium, but got it well done. It was the dryest burger I've had in a while. The meat was clearly frozen, and I imagine that it had been frozen for quite some time, given its powdery texture. Better places to order a burger to name a few: Hooters (that's not saying much), Wendy's, Five Guy's. The sweet potato fries were decent, but at an extra $4, it should come with some form of dipping sauce other than plain ole' ketchup. I should've stuck with my original gut instinct, which was to order a burger from Hillstone. The burgers at Hillstone are phenomenal, and one of the best burgers that I've ever had in my life.  Their burgers are expensive, but not much more than the $20 bucks I've spent at Redemption today, which proved to be a disaster. I won't be revisiting this place anytime soon, unless its for beers, and to ogle their waitresses.

Stopped by here for dinner on Friday after leaving Midtown 1015 because I saw that it had some good veggie options.  The place is actually pretty large - with ample seating inside and out.  They have high-top tables all throughout the main area of the bar with stools to sit on.The service is one of the slowest I have ever experienced.  After walking in, one of the waitresses said we could sit down anywhere.  After sitting down for a good 15-20min, we still had nobody approach us regarding a menu.  When we finally asked for food and drink menus,  I had to go find a waitress and actually get them myself because nobody came to drop them off.  Overall, we wasted at least 30min before even ordering our food and drinks.  All the waitresses just stood at the computer next to the bar, hanging out and talking - terrible.We ordered nachos for appetizer, and my friend and I both got burgers.  IF you order an appetizer and an entree here, remember to tell them to bring your app BEFORE bringing your main course.  Our food took forever to come and we were wondering where the nachos were, but we saw the server bring the nachos and both of our burgers at the same time.  There was barely enough room on the table for all three plates, plus our drinks, silverware, etc.  I thought it was common sense to bring an appetizer FIRST, especially when we said we'd have the nachos for appetizer, but I guess here, they don't do that.The nachos were actually very good and I would recommend them to everyone.  It is a ridiculously large portion, so I'd suggest sharing it between 3-4 people...my friend and I barely ate half of the nachos (but that could also be because our burgers were getting cold in front of us).  The veggie burger was...meh.  Wasn't good or bad, but it was really filling.  It's homemade, which is nice, but after eating about a third of it, I just couldn't eat any more.
This place does not give you the alcohol that you ordered, it's different I am an alcohol expert. I have a bar tending license in 5 states.  The people treated me like poop.
Tara's the best! The bar is so busy but she always makes time for you. Redemption is my neighborhood bar but Tara is my absolute favorite and keeps me coming back! Love her so much!

Had heard great things from friends about the brunch here. We went as a group of 5 (someone in our group recommended here) and we were slightly disappointed. This was probably because we had our expectations too high because there was nothing drastically wrong with the service. The food was decent slightly better than average sports bar brunch food Our server was friendly. The only issue was with the bottomless brunch option they were not refilling the glasses as we finished we always had to ask. We aren't the type that go to a bottomless brunch as a cheapskate option we were also buying rounds of top shelf liquor and tipped 30% (we all work in the industry). Once we settled our tab with the server we moved into the bar . I'll definitely return my friend did say it's a hit or miss spot. We had to ask several times for menus water etc minor details

I enjoyed a pleasant Saturday afternoon here watching football with a friend.  The burger was pretty good for standard bar fare.  What really impressed me, though were the martinis; they were very well prepared for sports bar.  It was Thanksgiving weekend so it was slow, but I feel  that it is worth mentioning that the service was quite attentive.  I look forward to returning.

Went here for the first time for the Giants-Redskins Week 17 game. We got here a little late but were lucky enough to snag seats at the bar. The bartender was super friendly at the atmosphere was just what you want for a sports bar. We all split a couple order of wings which were very good. The other food options looked very good as well. Would definitely be back anytime i'm in the area.

Pretty standard bar food - good but nothing outstanding. The service the other night (on a Wednesday) was terrible. The place wasn't very crowded and we were passed by several times. I finally flagged down a dark haired waitress for some water which was brought in a small cocktail glass which I thought was weird and annoying since the glass emptied fast and no one was coming to refill. When she did finally come back she entirely missed both our glasses spilling water all over the table and our legs/feet/leather shoes since the table was slatted. And no, she nor the bus boy brought over napkins. When our actual waitress came over she was very sweet & friendly. However we didn't see her much and wondered if she was even supposed to be working our table which was outside. They got one of the orders wrong and were fast to fix it - but at this point it was just another annoyance. For a casual bite this place is fine. Nothing special.  And be prepared for awful service.

The bartender (I think her name is Amanda) is awesome!!! Makes the BEST drinks and always has a smile MODE ON!!  The place is great, their menu goes great at the bar - My favorite place for lunch when a good drink is in order :D

I thought I'd seen it all, but apparently New York can still shock me. Nevermind the initial ignoring of me and my friend by the hostess and by the waitresses. Nevermind the fact that the waitress took forever to pay us any attention, and then finally came to our table without a smile or even any hint of personality or experience. Nevermind even how the beers we ordered never came. The part that it gets interesting is when we got fed up enough that our beers didn't come, and walked over to the bar to just buy a couple. Tab was $7 bucks, gave the bartender a $20, and she gave the change back AFTER she took a dollar tip. SHE TOOK HER TIP BEFORE GIVING US CHANGE. So much attitude, no gratitude, she was horrible. Flabbergasted, we go back to the table, a long time passes with our order not arriving, and we call the waitress over to get more beer. We tell her that she never brought over the beers we ordered from her. No apology, just a look at us as if to say "and?" with no response. Needless to say, we walked out. Don't know the waitress's name, all I know is she was brunette and wore glasses. If you go to this customer-service craphole of a place, do NOT sit in her section, and do NOT expect good service from any of these people. In fact, do NOT even come here. Go across the street.

Came here for a reunion with some frat bros of mine. The place is typical for a bar scene-music blaring sort of dark so you can't see if the person you leave with is actually an ugly heathen after your 73 shots of alcohol. The spacing is a bit small and kinda cramped .. But it's a bar so it's cool. I arrive and mush my way into a seat and the waiter comes over and asks if I want something and I love tequila and it's the summer so I start with a frozen margarita .. She tells me the "machine isn't working" .. HOW.. It's Friday at 9pm.. Did the graduating 8th grade class come here and abuse your machine before me?? So one of my brothers points to their other bar which from the expression on her face looked like she just found out about.. And he asks "what about that one" and she says she will check. Surely, she came back with the margaritas which were the most watery margaritas ever.. I must've mistakenly ordered a waterita. It tasted like one of those icy's where they vigorously scrape ice into a cup then squirt some juice on it and say "Wung Feety my frehn." Few folks ordered food but I chose not to after the reviews here and my waterita. I had like two shots after that and called it a day. The REAL gem.. Is the pizza place next to it with great slices and they're open late and LITERALLY next door so you can head over in between your wateritas and grab a slice.. I'm hungry writing about it. For all of the above including a nice waiter and low expectations.. 3 stars. That is all.
Great sports bar.  I usually go here to watch the Redskins play.  Very energetic and the food was solid for a sports bar.  It gets packed on Sundays so come well before your game starts.

It pains me to do this cause I had such high hopes. I had to give it one star cause our waitress was very kind. My sister and I wanted a low key night grab some drinks and have some dinner. We ordered 12 medium wings and mac and cheese. As soon as the wings came out and I smelled them, I knew I wouldn't like them. After a taste my initial thought was confirmed. GrossThe waitress saw the look on our faces and asked what was wrong. We told her, but didn't wanna be "those people" who sent it back. After 2/3 wings, I just couldn't do it, and focused on the yummy Mac and cheese. By our 2nd drink we started not to feel so well. We got the check and $104 (my eyes popped out of my head) later we left. In summary, my sister and I definitely have food poisoning. I can't tell if I'm going to vomit or crap myself and I'm sweating profusely. Should have sent them back and not be afraid of annoying the kitchen. SOS
Sat 20 minutes, never got served, so went to bar myself to get a couple beers. 16 dollars for 2 small draft beers. Terrible place. Stay away

Although a little small and tough to get seats sometimes , I love this place! Very reasonably priced food and drinks. My favorite Are their burgers and quesadillas.  Had the chicken lettuce wraps once and they were awful (so I won't be getting them again). Other than that a pleasant dining experience in a great location .

Redemption... you sure need to redeem yourself.I came by after work since it seemed like a spot that was poppin after work, with outdoor seating. Happy hour goes till 7pm. I arrived at 7pm so I didn't score any happy hour deals. The waitress picked a tiny table by the wall, I could not fit my fat ass into the seat because there was another table behind and the girl took up all the room. Trust me, no human would have fit into my seat unless you were a 5 year old kid, or a small dog. I asked if we could sit elsewhere and the hostess let us sit at a different table where a normal sized human could fit.Our waitress was dumb. Just dumb. I wonder if she understands English. We had ordered the 2 for 1 sangria, which cost us $12. The sangria came in small cups. Obviously they took 1 sangria and put it into 2 small glasses and say its 2 for 1. They had the red and the white sangria, the waitress recommended the red sangria so I went with the red. I have never tasted such unique sangria before, it was a blend of cough syrup and nasty boxed wine. Urgh. So disgusting. I didn't even finish both glasses of sangria because who wants to drink medicine?The waitress successfully screwed up every single order, what a record. Where did you hire your waitress? Hint: if you are a waitress who has been fired from every restaurant, I am sure Redemption will hire you. We started off with the wings, which comes with your choice of 2 sauces. Guess what? When we were served the wings, the waitress only brought us one sauce and walked away. I actually had to find her 5 min later to ask where the other sauce was. She claimed that they ran out. Seriously? She should have told us that way earlier instead of just not bringing us our sauce. She offered to bring me another sauce, I chose the spicy ketchup, which tasted like normal ketchup. Never mind, I am not here to teach her the different between normal ketchup and spicy ketchup.I was craving a delicious grilled cheese sandwich. I ordred a grilled cheese sandwich with turkey, with NO mustard. I hate mustard so much, if you put it in my sandwich, I won't eat it. Of course, my sandwich came served to me with lots of mustard melted between the bread and the cheese, so it was very difficult to scrape off. I took a bite and almost barfed. I called the waitress and she took the sandwich back to the kitchen. By the time I got a replacement sandwich, my friend had already finished her meal. The grilled turkey cheese sandwich was the driest sandwich ever. It tasted like horrible left over turkey that had been left out in the sun too long, which was carelessly slapped onto a pathetic piece of cheap bread, with cheap cheese melted on top of it. It was so dry and disgusting that I had to put ketchup on my food just to make it a little more appetizing.If you want to lose some weight, this is a great place to go to because the food is disgusting. Honestly, I'd rather eat at a street cart, some chicken and rice would not only be cheaper but would be much more appetizing.The only reason this place does not have one star is because the people are ok looking. My recommendation is to NOT EAT here, and AVOID the sangria at all costs, unless you want to drink medicine.

40 minutes to get our drinks, another 40 to get the water we asked for 5 times. We walked in at 145 and didn't leave till 445. Funny enough, we would have been fine with the time if the service had been attentive and at least kept the drinks flowing. When I asked if the portobello mushroom was marinated, she answered me with "it's grilled" when I tried to clarify I meant prior to grilling, she answered "yes, they put salt and pepper on it **giggle*" So we finally get our food at 3:45, it was pretty ok. Nothing to get excited over. Certainly not worth waiting 2 hours to eat (arguably they could have marinated the portobello in that time) Thank goodness the company for this 3 hour journey was fabulous. I should clarify it wasn't that busy. There was no plausible excuse for this hot mess. I'm sure this place is ok for a drink. But I'd order at the bar.

Very cool spot. Tons of outdoor seating and diverse brunch menu. Everything from eggs, fried chicken, burgers, wings until 5PM on the weekends. Portions were a little bit small (I had the Southwest Scramblette).

Chicken and waffles = soft, cold, seemingly microwaved waffles and chewy chicken tenders. Asked waitress if waffle was microwaved. "I'll mention to the chef" - no offer to remedy. Skip it if you're going for food.

I came here  with coworkers for Happy Hour. Food and drink were very good; the selection was extensive as well. Def try the nacho chips here, super delicious. Mozarella sticks are also highly recommended. I'm not a big fan of wings or hummus, but you get the idea, they serve everything. The quality delivered by Redemption is the key :DOur waitor was very nice. In sum, this is the kind of bar I feel very comfortable to be at. I can see myself coming back for more happy hour fun.

This place is one of my favorites!!! Great memories, Great bar in great location. Not flashy as some but definitely respectable NY lounge/bar. They also have a VIP room which was smaller in lower level and good when we had private occasions. Nice spring days bar has outside seating too. Terrific Happy hour specials.
2.5-3 stars is about right for this restaurant. The curb appeal is nice, but the food and service is just average - not bad, but just average. I usually have more to say but not for this review.

Fun atmosphere. However, don't get the sangria. It's tasty and refreshing but no alcohol. I can usually only handle 3 beers tops and I had 6 glasses of sangria last night and not even a buzz. Not that it was my goal, but come on. 6 glasses of fruit juice. Guacamole is good. Crowd is good. Just stick to beer.

awsome thrusday night, place was packed to the edges with all kinds of people, from interns to professionals. EVeryone was having fun and chit chatting and mingling with everyone. The staff is great and fast to attend you. The waitresses are super hot.. i mean model like hot and not snotty at all.Drinks are 10 bucks a pop and a bit light. taking a star away for the light drinks.....i will definetly go back and stick to beers :)

Came here and sat outside, service was very friendly. We ordered wings to start, which there were only 5 or 6 wings in total, with a side of fries. I'd say skip the fries and give a few more wings...I ordered the BLTE, which was really good - I will be definitely be making this at home one day. I also checked in on Yelp to get my free domestic beer, showed the waitress but she still charged me for it. $7 for a bud light, sigh. Wish I just stuck the Milk Stout I ordered, that was good at least for $8.

Celebrated my birthday here a few years back and have gone in for drinks from time to time.  When setting up my birthday and locking down a table for 16, their service was impeccable and friendly throughout.  The manager set us up with an open bar package and we had dinner there beforehand.On a "regular" day, Redemption is a nice low-key place to catch an afternoon sports game, especially during the warmer months when they open up all the windows, providing a nice airy atmosphere for patrons.  It doesn't get nearly as crowded as Sutton Place right nearby, so if you're in the area and looking for a place to sit and relax to a drink and some light bar fare during the day, I'd recommend Redemption.

Located among a long line of Irish pubs among 2nd Ave. Midtown east, Redemption stands as a beacon of fun with decent gastrointestinal pub eats.  A Chameleon of an establishment where corporate types fill the place for lunch. Happy hour brings in more of the same and some left over from lunch lol.  By 8pm Redemption turns into a 20-30 somerhing lively social pick-up dominated scene.  The smallish bar/restaurant has a back room that opens up for overflow.  Outdoor dining weather permitted.  I personally like the southwest salad with chickem.  Turkey burger is great with great buns.  The wait staff are very friendly,  attractive and responsive.  Michelle is terrific always with a smile even with a very hectic busy establishment.  Rhianna is new having taken over for Danielle always with a smile quick with a beer a d great attitude.  Definately a go to spot no matter what time of day
Awful service and very watered down $11.00 drinks.  The wait staff and bartender were drunk and couldn't care less. This place desperately needs bar rescue!!!!!!!

Lunch and happy hour onlyMy decision on a late afternoon lunch quest, Redemption proved a great choice. Not only was the burger superb, but the free tap beer with check in was an added bonus. The "Baller" burger came cooked perfectly to order loaded with fresh arugula and mouth watering smoked bacon, goat cheese, and aioli. Oh jeez... Food coma approaching... Seriously though, the bacon was just crispy enough without being burnt, and and the goat cheese just soft enough to be heavenly.  If I could review the burger only, it'd be 4 stars, maybe 5.  Unfortunately, this isn't a food cart, so...Sitting at the bar, the service is fine, though they could benefit from being slightly more attentive. Beer selection is acceptable considering it's midtown east. And while I normally avoid this neighborhood like the plague, prior to about 5:30pm it's totally a fantastic lunch place and a great pub.  After 5:30, the Top40 gets turned up, and the neighboring conversations about whether or not you wear Hollister begin.  $4 happy hour until 7pm does not make up for such an appalling excuse for bar chatter.  Needless to say, I grabbed my check and took off straightaway.In conclusion, I was almost tricked into giving this place a 4 star rating.  Redemption, you could be something so much better if you kept the number of lame, douchey patrons to a minimum.

Came in on a Saturday night for some grub and a few beers, not expecting 5 star service our typically outstanding food other than pubgrub, but some service to be expected. We grabbed spots at the bar, and I had to get the bartender's attention from her re-stocking liquor duties to order a beer. repeat, this is EARLY Saturday night.. restocking bottles should be done during the DAY? I ordered a pbr and my boyfriend never got to choose, he was given a pbr as well. we ordered some food.. boyfriend got a burger (was never asked how he liked it, medium, rare? don't care? or no choice) and were offered tater tots or fries blah blah.. ah ok, we each ordered the tater tots. A few beers later, we wrapped up our greasy as F food, I couldn't even finish half of the grilled cheese it was dripping in grease- wrapped up the tots as well. Asked for our check.. over $100... what? for some greasy food and a few beers and barely noticed at the bar? I coulda gone to smith and wollenskys and gotten a steak dinner! we challenged the tater tots as they were never described as an additional order, and thankfully the manager got involved and took them off the bill. I begrudgingly left a small tip, but stay away from this mediocre midtown watering hole- unless you don't care what the bill looks like, and if you are into being ignored by and cheated the staff. fighting over tater tots.. I shake my head...
This bar on Sunday's during football season is paradise. Good food and $20 beer towers? Sign me up ! Hail To The Redskins!
Great spot to watch sporting events - TVs are all over the place and lot's of seats to choose from. Food is good, but service sometimes might take a bit of time.

This is my first time here and I must say this is a great bar/lounge!! I came with my girlfriends (5 of us) and the management (Edward) and staff have been a true pleasure. The music is bumping, food was great (I got the bison lettuce wrap burger) ! Everyone enjoyed their meal and we got free shots on the house and desert on the house!!! They always checked up on us throughout the night and the crowd was great!!! I'm definitely coming back here with more people!!! Thank you Redemption for being so AWESOME

This place is really small, but a solid spot to catch a sports game and score some cheap drinks. I haven't ate food here, but I always end up getting a few drinks. They have buy one sangria, get one free which is a great deal for only $10. They also have an array of mixed drinks that are fairly priced that will get you a buzz by the second drink. I recommend going here with a friend or two to grab a drink.

If you are looking to be transported back to middle school prom circa 1998, challenged met. This place reeks of dirty socks and the staffs over inflated egos makes you question how this bar is still running. One of the bartenders was dancing on the bar like she thought she was in Coyote Ugly... She was just ugly... Nothing more...Aside from the horrible service we received someone had explosive diarrhea in not one but two of the bathroom stalls I entered. After entering the second I gave up and felt it was better just to hold it in. The state of their bathrooms was a perfect reflection of the quality of beer Redemption serves. Crap. My Stella was flat and room temperature warm. Perhaps a mishap, so I ordered a bottled beer which is impossible to mess up. It was right, aside from being a little too warm. The most disturbing part of this bar must be the manager. His dog-like demeanor to all of the women in the bar made everyone feel extremely uncomfortable, and his bacon grease hairdo was of no aid to him. If you want a bar where you can get drunk with trash while listening to mediocre music and being surrounded by overweight middle aged men then this is where you belong. Otherwise do yourself a favor and walk a few blocks further to any other bar.Thoroughly disappointed.

I stumbled upon this place on a Thursday evening looking for a good dinner and beers with a friend. The beers? Yes, we got them. They had a $4 Stella and $3 bud light special, so there's a plus. In terms of food, save your appetite for somewhere else. The quesadilla appetizer was very small and was nothing special. I ordered the chop salad with steak ($5 extra for the steak). The salad looked like it came out of a packaged bag and the steak was probably 4 ounces of burnt meat, probably leftover from a steak sandwich. I'll be back only for a beer or two. Definitely finding dinner somewhere else.

I'm came for lunch for right and I'm pretty irritated with how the staff seems totally unable to handle the modest crowd. It's not even full but they're running around like the place is a madhouse. I had to flag down a server to place my order and other than that have not been tended to in any way. Pretty disappointed by the service. Don't go here if you have another option.

Worst bar in manhattan.. Spent a lot of money here and have never received a buy back. Also make you pay if the bartender takes a shit with you. If you want ok food with the cheapest people in NYC, go there!!

Rude. Walked in at 11:30 to eat brunch. Stood inside the entrance for at least 5 minutes, not a single employee acknowledged me. The bartender kind of glanced at me and looked away. Finally gave up, and walked across the street to the Upsider, was greeted and added to the wait list.

Maybe it's just the demographic of patrons at Redemption, but do they always seem to be playing music that's from the late 90s-early 2000s? I like to believe that I've found my own little nostalgic haven.Great wings, can't go wrong with tater tots, great half price wine specials, always packed.

Stopped by for a quick dinner - pretty decent bar food and a fun atmosphere. Got "The Baller" burger and it was quite yummy. Service was a bit slow but waitress was very kind - it was busy on a Thursday night. But I'd come back if I were in midtown again!
Had an incident.Bar manager did what she could to rectify it making both myself and the bar happy.What else can one say?

Redemption is really bad - it's an after work spot for people before they hit Grand Central and go back to Long Island.Why are the beers $8?Why did I not get happy hour prices at 6:30pm?Why do the bartenders wear ear plugs? Do you know how difficult communication is?Why is this place all male? Not fun..

Came in last night and had a great time.The drinks were really good, we had some good apps too.  The salsa and guac tasted really fresh and delicious.  The spinach dip was also very good.  I had a really awful Tom Collins earlier, so to have it done right was nice.  The waitress was very friendly and helpful.It looked like they were doing some renovations to the back.  I would love to see what they do.  Had a good time and will go back.

Walked in and liked the atmosphere. Laid back and simple. But then my beer comes. I take the first drink, and there's a hair in it. I hoped it was one of mine, but not likely considering the hair was black and I have blonde hair . I ordered the Bison Burger with fries. First bite, bloody grease squirts out of the other side of the burger all of the table. I could probably handle it if the burger was any good, but it was extremely bland and flavorless. Girlfriend ordered boneless chicken wings, she was not a fan either. Fries were decent, that's about it. Boo.
Smoking hot bartenders/waitstaff. Manager was very accommodating. Great music. Lots of tvs. Get the quesadilla.

Great service, came here for my friends birthday and started with the happy hour nachos enough for 2 for only $6, they were delicious. Corporate crowd, definitely a sports bar with lots of men great place to meet people. Would come back to midtown for the 2 for 1 sangria although I live in lower east side.

Drinks were fine, service was fine. I tried their Philly cheesesteak.. small portion and a bit pricey but it was actually pretty good.Normally I'd give this 4 or 5 star rating but... I was there for a friend's birthday, so we were all in a big group. The waitress took orders but never asked for cash or if we wanted to start a tab, so I kinda just assumed that either she was doing the tabs by table or my friend had set everything up to be charged together and then we'd divide it up at the end of the night. Instead, some of us got charged really ridiculous amounts - I'm pretty sure the waitress messed up somehow because we did the math several times and it just didn't add up. It caused some drama and many of us ended up paying more than what we actually consumed. The waitress really should've clarified the payment method(s) with everybody early in the night... although I can't even blame her too much because they had her working a party of like 20+ people by herself. It really ruined what had been a good night and ensured that my friends and I won't be returning here, since it left such a bad taste in our mouths.

My first experience at Redemption was one to forget, a packed bar with one waitress and a completely disorganized staff made for a disaster of a meal during Friday lunch. Me and my friend decided to go back to Redemption for a Sunday soccer game (mainly because it happened to be the only bar on second ave in midtown open at 11am on Sunday) and had a great experience. Their all you can drink bloody's, screwdrivers, and mimosas for two hours for $15 is a pretty surreal deal. Their brunch menu, while not too extensive covers all of the basic cravings one would have at a manageable price. The bartender was about as cool as it gets and even let us drink under the $15 deal for close to 3 hours, all while socializing with us and adhering to our requests of the sporting events that were shown on their TV's.For $30, i walked out stuffed and heavily buzzed.....not too shabby for a Sunday morning!

Moved in just down the block, and this is a pretty solid neighborhood spot to have. They have a good deal going on everyday for drinks. Went on a Monday for happy hour with a friend, and beer selection was your usual light beers with a 1-2 craft options in the mix. Sangria is delicious and always buy one get one free (one costs $12). Never too crowded, and great spot to watch sports.Also went there for brunch. Entrees are priced $11-16, with an option for unlimited mimosas and bloodys for another $15. Didn't opt for the drinks, but the food was decent.

They have $3 Bud lite which was exactly what I needed after a stressful day at work and a stressful week in life. By myself, crying, over a beer. Until yelp cigar time. I like that my moment went uninterrupted after I threw my four dollars down. I don't particularly like that it wasn't a full-sized pint. But whatever, beggars can be choosers. They appeared to have some unusual kind of fruit punch on the counter-tops. I didn't inquire to the yellow and red froths but they were intriguing. Honesty gets you nowhere in life. But at least there will always be $3 buds and Redemption.

Horrible service . The server forgot my mayo and musturd and told me the reason my turkey burger was pink is because it was organic.  Really? When I order food I expect it to be fully cooked unless other wise specified.  The bar tender  in the back was cursing and talking about some guy she fcked  out of spite. . #ghetto. Why do your bartenders wear bras? Is this a night club?

Enjoyed a good brunch with bottomless Mimosas.  The brunch itself was tasty but when we saw the woman on the table near us order dessert we had to do the same.Enter the Fried Oreos w/ Nutella Shake!  Definitely one of those forbidden pleasures in life that my arteries and sugar levels would've been better off not knowing about but my soul will never be the same again!  Must have...A 2 hour limit on the mimosas was sufficient to say the least!
Pretty good burger, waitress inexperienced but very pleasant. drink very tasty but inconsistent First round of drinks pretty strong second second-round not so much.

Went there for a happy hour.  It was OK.  Filled with people in their early 20's so if you are young and starting out in the work force this is the place to be.  Since I'm more aged and seasoned I wasn't too impressed.  But I was happy about being able to get a seat easily at the bar (that's of high value to old folks like me).  The bartenders were pretty nice, my male friends were happy by how attractive they were.  Sorry straight females, the staff was all female so no eye candy with the staff in this spot.Drinks were good.  I didn't eat there but they do have an outside eating area.  As for happy hour, if you are young this is a great spot for you.

I'm giving two stars for the food itself. I got a burger with goat cheese, arugula, and bacon and it was delicious and cooked perfectly. The fries were good too. However, the service was awful! Waited 20 minutes to get our beers, then the waitress came to the table, picked my friend's beer off of the table to check the alc % for another customer, and put it back down without saying a word to us. That was pretty rude, in my opinion. The waitress also forgot to bring a glass for our drinks, and forgot to put in our order of fries. In the end, she ended up putting in the wrong size fry order so we took the price difference out of her tip. I would not return to Redemption for another meal, ever.

After walking up to the bar and ordering a salad TO GO I waited 15 minutes only to be told "here's your salad. By the way there's a 20$ minimum on cards".  I didn't have cash so She asked the manager what to do  he said no dice before she hastily snatched back my salad. I could be wrong but I was under the impression that was a self imposed rule business owners implement. Would have been nice of them to mention that when I ordered since clearly that's all I was going to be ordering with it being to go and all. When I respectfully said that I got excuses and attitude back. Poor business skills. Would have saved a customer if they had said "my bad. Here. Our fault. Take it anyway" instead of throwing it in the trash. No bueno!

Terrible experience.. a friend and I popped in for a drink after work.  I asked what type of tequila was in a drink featured on their menu.  The bartender snatched the menu and began reading about the drink. I asked if he had made it before (since he had to read the menu out of my hand to figure out what I was talking about) and he told me to NEVER QUESTION A REDEMPTION BARTENDER. ew bye.

Unlimited mimosas = immediately on our Saturday morning agenda.Redemption failed to impress, though.Strike One: no toilet paper in the ladies room. In any of the three stalls. It was noon.. Not midnight on Friday night. It's almost like they just did not restock from the night before. Sorry, Redemption, for the paper towels in your plumbing.Strike Two: dirty dishes on the bar. The servers cleared dirty glasses to the bar, between people sitting at the bar, for washing. Isn't that why there's a service bar? Very gross.Strike Three: food was just ok. Huevos Rancheros were watery. And since when are hash browns 50% potatoes and 50% onions and peppers?Sorry Redemption, you're out.

Hit or miss. Definitely need to hit it on a Wednesday-Saturday(or drinking Holiday of course), otherwise it will surely be dead. Good place to chill back and kick a few cold ones! The bartenders are real friendly and laid back. Food: I've had the quesadilla. It was good.Drinks: about average for the area. Overall: good place to chill back, maybe get a beer and some food. There are better places to meet women, if that's what you're going for though, cause it's not always busy.

Food 4/5....Short Rib Grilled Cheese and Spinach dip yumm.Decor 4/5...Good set up and lighting.Music 4/5.....Loud for a Tuesday but good.Bathroom 1/5....ewww.Service 1/5....Lost our waitress for a good 30mins. Def an after work spot (suit up!), we got here at 8pm it was packed by 10pm it was empty.
Fun, upscale sports bar with a friendly staff. Only came here for a drink and to watch a game so I can't comment on the food, but would definitely give this place another visit.

It never hurts to have a best friend doing a liquor promotion for pinnacle whipped... or a friend behind the bar... but regardless, without those factors, the odds of me heading to midtown for a drink were slim.  Definitely a win in my book.  The place was nice, clean, and had a chill vibe.  Ample space and TVs for game-watching.   They had a decent cocktail menu and pretty typical food menu.  I had a beets and goat cheese salad that tasted great and fresh and some sweet potato fries.  All up to par. They said there's a DJ and a dance area that I thought might be worth checking out some other time.  Decent prices, good specials and deals, and of course a great staff.

You'd think this place would be screaming depressed since it is a Redskins bar, but the vibe was pretty upbeat. I guess Redskins fans are used to the beatings. (Sorry Ali, had to do it.)The specials are pretty great during Redskins games on beer, wings, nachos and fries. Nachos and fries were great. I realize the sliders are a bargain, but a little lettuce and tomato would go a long way to spruce these puppies up. My one complaint was the beer towers. Even though they were huge, kept cold with ice bags, and readily refilled by the super nice waitresses......they don't clean the nozzles properly (see attached photo - this one wasn't as bad as some) and we had moldy floaties streaming into our beer. Two of the four towers we ordered wouldn't pass a health inspection. The one delivering the free mold floaties we notified our server who was equally grossed out and replaced. Please. Please. Please make this a note of attention to clean going forward. Everything was reasonably priced and the waitresses really were super nice. I had a great time at this bar and would return.

Trudging through a record-breaking blizzard in New York City, I sought redemption in form of an adult beverage on Sunday night. Nothing was open along Second Avenue, and I was starting to hallucinate: snow drifts turned into sand dunes at the beach...instead of 50 mph winds burning my face and turning it red, it was the relentless sun. There, that's better. But...I still need a damn drink!Enter the Redemption Cocktail Lounge.Redemption? There's *none* of that up in here! screamed my brain as I looked over the utterly banal cocktail menu that looked like it had been conceived and printed in 1994. This is Manhattan, I assured myself, although the blizzard had me wondering if I had somehow stepped into a black hole that allows for immediate travel to the Jersey Shore (that's what I get for hallucinating the beach. I'll take the blizzard, thank you very much). It bugs me when non native New Yorkers speak disparagingly of "bridge and tunnel" folks, but I'm allowed because I'm a native, so nyah! This place was chock full of 'em.,,,though that's impossible. Like I said, there was the record breaking Christmas blizzard going on and travel between boroughs was all but impossible. So, where did these people come from, pray tell? I would have left as soon as I crossed the threshold and heard the first notes of cheesy bad R&B coming from the PA, but like I said, there was a blizzard and my friend and I were looking for somewhere, *anywhere* at this point, to throw down a few. So, we stayed. I opted for a glass of wine instead of a Sex on the Beach or any other lousy dated cocktail choice from the menu and my friend stuck to vodka/Redbulls.To be fair, service was with a smile (though the bartender was also the waitress and we had to flag her down for service in a bar that was not at all busy). The quest for redemption came to a final standstill once we received the bill. Indeed, we were charged Manhattan cocktail lounge prices for the Jersey Shore experience. I urge you to seek redemption where there is some to be found.And it ain't here, sailor.

burger was cooked med rare when ordered med well.  i wanted to send back but couldn't find the server for a few minutes and was pressed for time, so i just ate it and didn't say anything.  server was very nice just spread to thin i guess.
Service sucked. Tried baller burger with goat cheese and really liked it. Sweet potato fries were very good

Typical dive bar with a decent happy hour. Nothing fancy but it's not trying to be. On the whole pretty good value, plays sports and poker. The waitresses make a good effort. For casual drinks in midtown, this is a good choice

This was the lamest bar I've ever been to in NY. Total bro crowd. Probably rad if you wanna discuss investment portfolios and not make friends. You can probably bring your lacrosse stick and get a good pick up game together after closing time. I feel like someone would give me a noogie or wet willy here. The staff was awesome as shot but the crowd was sack. Beers were cheap though, so I upped a star.

It is small but cozy and comfortable inside . They are the tables to sit down bar in the front and bar in the back . The Food is great  , hamburgers are huge , ....DELICIOUS!!!!!The service  here is excellent 100% better than the service you will receive at their neighbor next door Midtown . From the bouncers to the waitstaff to the bartenders all are helpful patience and friendly at REDEMPTION. I had a frozen Margarita which was tasty just right. I would definitely return again. Thank you for being so welcoming and entertaining.
